td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:f tennis player aged 36 yrs presents via EMS 2 days following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head. Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 35 mph on impact. patient c/o mild blurred vision, mild dizziness, moderate neck pain and Traumatic Injury - Blunt.No loss of consciousness o:Height 163 cm, Weight 44.2 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, NAD, Neck = supple w/o TTP, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL w/ no deficits, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Psych = Mood, affect NL, appropriate judgement a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:white F tennis player aged 36 years presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion. she denies neck pain, blurred vision and dizziness. Furthermore, she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 164 cm, Weight 44.8 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=95,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=42.1,Reaction Time=0.51, HEENT = NCAT, PERRL, C/V = RRR, Abd = Soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, Neuro = CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Neck = Supple, Pulm = CTAB. Good respiratory effort, MS = Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with no loss of consciousness). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Neck = Supple , Pulm = CTAB
